Substantial Justice.definition: justice of a sufficient degree esp. to satisfy a standard of fairness ;also
Substantial Justice.origin: [all pleadings shall be so construed as to do substantial justice " Federal Rules of Civil Procedure Rule 8(f)"]

1.1: justice of a sufficient degree esp. to satisfy a standard of fairness

2.1: justice administered according to the substance and not necessarily the form of the law [all pleadings shall be so construed as to do
